inclusion.criterion: Eligible women who agree to participate will undergo a baseline interview.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Information collected during the enrollment interview will include demographic data and information on the participant's general and reproductive health.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The participants will be given their first study packet which will contain either Cupid, Cupid 2 or FC2 with a diary for the first month of the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Research staff will discuss with the participant how many condoms they require for the month.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The participants will be instructed how to complete the diary card.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: There will be six follow-up visits in person at 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 months.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participants will be administered a follow-up survey about their experiences using their randomized FC.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A pregnancy test will be carried out at every on-site visit.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Women will be discontinued from the study at any stage during follow-up for: pregnancy, unwillingness to continue use of FCs or change to a non-study contraceptive method as her main contraceptive method, or refusal to be followed up.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A statistician (not otherwise involved in this study) will develop the random allocation sequence using a validated statistical program in Stata (StataCorp LP, College Station, Texas, USA).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Use-order assignments will be generated via the RedCap electronic program.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Have a history of allergy or sensitivity to rubber latex or water-based /silicone lubricants.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Be pregnant, have a suspected pregnancy or desire to become pregnant during the course of the study.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has history of acne and mild hirsutism. She recently noticed gradual enlargement of her hands and feet and recognized that her ring is getting small for her finger.
